result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Attempt Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: As to count one:  $6,374.00 payable to Katherine B.  Joint and several with 14CF80 Deonte Hill.

EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharges. 
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Defendant will be eligible for Extended Supervision after 32 years, on or after 10/9/2046.
Credit for 275 days.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted  felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one. Credit for **275 days.

Written Explantation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Ineligible Voting Notice; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Eric L Hill in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Eric L Hill in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Soutone P.; Sabrina J.; Ruby W.; Katherine B.
AS TO COUNT 1:   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of LIFE in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 275 days time served.  Defendant will be eligible for extended supervision  after 32 years on or after 10-9-2046.
AS TO COUNT 2:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 19 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 275 days time served, concurrent with count 1.  CONFINEMENT of 12 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 7 YEARS.  
The following conditions:
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
As to restitution in count 1: the state is requesting $6374.00 payable to Katherine B.  Defendant takes no position.  The Court will order restitution payable to Katherine B. joint and several with (14CF80) Deonte Hill.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
 Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
NOTICE OF INTENT TO PURSUE POST-CONVICTION RELIEF RECEIVED AND FILED ON 10-9-14.pk

Defendant Eric L Hill in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Eric L Hill in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
At the hour of 1:35pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to both counts as charged in the information, which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to both counts.

  On joint request, Court ordered presentence investigation without recommendation. Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38 on 09/25/2014 at 8:15am.

Defendant Eric L Hill in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Eric L Hill in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
At the hour of 9:26am jury back in box.  Court completed instructing the jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:21am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Boushon and Spottek who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Eric L Hill in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Eric L Hill in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

At the hour of  9:16am the jury trial resumed.  Jury back in box. 
Re-sworn for the state: Co-defendant Deonte Hill with attorney Michael Torphy. 
Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Detective Charles Mueller, Milwaukee County Medical Examiners Office employee Dr. Brian Linert, Milwaukee Police Detective David Dalland and Milwaukee Police Detective Kevin Klemstein.
Exhibits 88, 94 and 89 received and read to the jury.
Exhibits 58, 59, 90 received.  
At the hour of 11:57am the jury was dismissed for lunch and advised to return at 1:00pm.  Jury out of box.

As the hour of 1:11pm the jury back in box.
Previously sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Detective Kevin Klemstein
Exhibits 72, 70 received. 
Exhibits 91 and 93 received and published to the jury.
State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily agreed to testify.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Eric Hill.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court began instructing the jury. At the hour of 4:37pm the jury was dismissed but instructed to return 07/31/14 at 9:15am

Defendant Eric L Hill in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Eric L Hill in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

At the hour of 9:30am jury back in box.  
Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Detective Patrick Pajot.
Exhibits 62-66, 73-75, 78-81, 84, 85 received.
Exhibits 1-11, 14-31, 67-69, 92, 95-102, 1A and 1B received and published to the jury.  
At the hour of 11:59am the jury was dismissed for lunch, but told to return at 1:00pm.  Jury out of box.

As the hour of 1:07pm jury back in box.
Sworn for the State: Citizen Debbie W, Milwaukee Police Officer Roberto Hernandez, Milwaukee Police Detective Carolyn Tillman, Milwaukee Police Detective Rodney Young, and Co-defendant Deonte Hill with attorney Michael Torphy.
Exhibits 103, 71, 86, 77, 82 received.
Exhibits 32-56 received and published to the jury.  
Exhibits 62, 63, 64, 32 (previously received) published to the jury.

At the hour of 4:55pm jury was dismissed for the evening with instructions to return 07/30/2014 at 8:55am.

Defendant Eric L Hill in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Eric L Hill in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 10:50am. At 11:15 the jury was dismissed for lunch, but told to return at 12:55pm.  Jury out of box.

Jury back in box.  At the hour of 1:06pm voir dire continued.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: 
Citizen Witnesses Harjinder S, Leo Y and Brittany S.  
Milwaukee Police Officers Michael Mattioli, Billie Ellis and Richard Voden.
Milwaukee Police Detective Timothy Wallich and Shelondia Tarver.

Exhibits 12, 13, 57, 60 and 61 received and published.  Exhibits 76, 97, 83, 98 and 87 received.

Defendant Eric L Hill in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Eric L Hill in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial and remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 07/28/2014.  State revokes their offer.  Defense witness list is due one week from today.

Defendant Eric L Hill in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Eric L Hill in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State's Motion as to Dying Declaration proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  PO Michael Mattioli(MPD).
State rests.  Defense offers no testimony.  Arguments by counsels.  The Court rules that pursuant to the Beauchamp decision that statement of the decedent is admissable as it asserts reliability and is non-confrontational.
As to the assertion of the right to counsel, the Court has reviewed the CD and transcripts as to the interrogation of the defendant.  The Court finds that the statement given by the defendant was free and voluntary and a waiver of his Miranda rights.  The Court will allow the statement to be admitted.
Case is adjourned to 7-2-2014 at 8:15 for final pretrial.

Attorney Mark S Rosen in court, defendant Eric L Hill not in court, in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Status conference held.  Case adjourned for Evidentiary Hearing in Branch 38 on June 13, 2014 at 8:15 am.

Defendant Eric L Hill in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Eric L Hill in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rosen has just been appointed and will be receiving discovery from prior counsel today.   Atty Rosen has reviewed the motions filed by Atty LeBell and will be adopting those motions.   The Court will vacate the status date of 5-12-2014 and set a new status on 5-30-2014.
Case set for final pretrial/motions on 6-13-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 7-28-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All additional motions to be filed by 5-30-2014.

Defendant Eric L Hill in court with attorney Robert G LeBell.  Defendant Eric L Hill in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court ordered case adjourned for an Arraignment in Branch 38.  Attorney Lebell has preserved his right to a motion to dismiss the criminal complaint.  Arraignment scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.W. (4/8/1967).

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Eric L Hill in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Defendant Eric L Hill in custody.  Nicholas S. Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
